roadway_dispersion
Class constants

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--roadway_dispersion.constants
public class constants
extends java.lang.Object

Overview
The constants class stores all roadway dispersion constants into one class. Note - All units in this file and the model are metric (MKS) unless otherwise stated. This file reduces the likelyhood of magic numbers appearing in the code.

public static final double SECONDS_PER_HOUR
Conversion from hours to seconds = 3600.

METERS_PER_MILE

public static final double METERS_PER_MILE
Conversion from miles to meters.

ATMS_PER_mmHG

public static final double ATMS_PER_mmHG
Conversion of pressure in mmHG to atmospheres (atms).

PI

public static final double PI
Geometric constant PI (3.14 ...).

RADIANS_TO_DEGREES

public static final double RADIANS_TO_DEGREES
Unit conversion constant RADIANS_TO_DEGREES = 180/pi. Allows conversion from radians to degrees.

DEGREES_TO_RADIANS

public static final double DEGREES_TO_RADIANS
Unit conversion constant DEGREES_TO_RADIANS = pi/180. Allows conversion from degrees to radians.

DISTANCE_TOLERANCE

public static final double DISTANCE_TOLERANCE
Constant DISTANCE_TOLERANCE is the distance at which two object will be considered coincident. This will prevent divide by 0 problems and will improve the accuracy of the bessel funciton calculations.

LOOPING_EPSILON

public static final double LOOPING_EPSILON
Constant LOOPING_EPSILON is used to avoid rounding errors in for loops condition tests.

HUANG_1

public static final double HUANG_1
Constant HUANG_1 is used in huang dispersion equation denomenator = sqrt(2 PI). It is defined here as a constant to avoid it being calculated each time the bessel function is evaluated.
